reviews.review: a

The game play is very easy to pick up. The majority of the game is really easy to progress through and the puzzles using the portals are pretty fun. There are small tidbits that lead up to the twist in the final level. The game is pretty short at about 4-5 hours but it is really fun.
WOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOO
One of the best puzzle games I've ever played. Short, but once you do the challenges you will have clocked at least 10+ hours overall.
fun puzzle game

Almost the perfect game, the gameplay is exciting and fun, the puzzles are hard but have a variety of ways to solve them which makes it fun for multiple playthroughs. The lore isnt great (its better in the second)m but its still there. It's almost a horror game in some regards with the endless lonliness of the facility, not scary but still.
9.5/10

I think this is a wonderful game for players just getting their grips into gaming. Though aimed at older players, I see no reason why younger players shoudnt be able to experience this game. It's a quick game, around 2 hours tops for me. I think this game appeals to almost any kind of gamer
This made very sad  when the part i need to throw away my companion cube but still its a very challenging game, i really recommend it to people who loves physics
Great Game!
v

This game is super short, like under 2 hours if you really go at it, but, that said, it is 100% worth it.  I recently just replayed it for the first time in a few years, and it's still an amazing puzzle//platformer that's hard to describe, but totally worth playing.  The best way I can think of describing it, is a 3D Sudoku, where the antagonist smack talks you all the way though :)
Portal is one of my favorite games. With the incredibly unique gameplay elements, interesting story, and amazing level design, Portal makes for one of Valve's best games
Very fun. Good first game for anyone getting into gaming. Short, but worth it
love Glados

Portal is definitely one of my favorite puzzle games. The game starts out simple enough, but gets somewhat challenging as it goes on, although not to the point where some may give up. The mechanics of the portal gun are unlike anything in any other puzzle game I've played, and it's a ton of fun to play with. Portal is a bit short, but that's just about the only thing "bad" about it.

Great game!! Really fun ways to use the portals, the physics of it is crazy and make sense (if there were portals). Jumping back and forth between two portals is my favorite hobby. The whole game is really preparing you for level 19. Haven't finished it yet, but am having fun ;D

A pesar de que han pasado a√±os desde su lanzamiento, sigue siendo un juego recomendable y ha envejecido muy bien. Es f√°cil encontrarlo a buen precio en un pack junto con el resto de juegos de Valve.

An√°lisis por apartados:
+Historia: La trama se va desvelando a medida que avanza el juego... aunque no completamente. Bastante original.
+Duraci√≥n: El modo historio puede pasarse en una sola tarde. Por suerte hay mapas adicionales que alargan mucho la vida del juego.
+Jugabilidad: Es f√°cil de hacerse con los controles en principio, aunque algunos puzzles requieren bastante habilidad.
+Gr√°ficos: M√°s que aceptables, teniendo en cuenta los a√±os que tiene.
+Sonido: Una atm√≥sfera tranquila salvo por GLaDOS y los robots de defensa. Tienen mucho carisma y ayudan a darle un toque de humor al juego.
+Traducci√≥n: Se agradece el doblaje al castellano. La versi√≥n espa√±ola de GLaDOS es fiel a la original.
+Dificultad: Adecuada en el modo historia, y tan dif√≠cil como quieras imaginarla en los mapas adicionales. Eso hace que el juego sea apto para todo tipo de jugadores.
-Multijugador: Inexistente por desgracia. Afortunadamente Portal 2 si cuenta con este modo.
-Uso de mando: Solo algunos modelos funcionan. En mi caso Steam Controller ha funcionado, pero Dual Shock no, ni siquiera usando x360ce o las opciones de "consola" que recomienda Valve.
This game is amazing! Play it! It has tons of replayability and very well designed levels!
